data.title: Republic Records
data.meta_description: A division of Universal Music Group, the world’s leading music company, Republic Records has been recognized by Billboard as the industry’s #1 label over the last 10 years. It is home to an all-star roster of multi-platinum, award-winning legends and superstar artists such as Anitta, Ariana Grande, Billy Porter, Coi Leray, Conan Gray, Daddy Yankee, Drake, Eddie Vedder, Glass Animals, Florence + the Machine, Greta Van Fleet, Jack Johnson, James Blake, James Bay, Jimmy Fallon, John Legend, John Mellencamp, Jonas Brothers, Kid Cudi, Kim Petras, Lil Wayne, Lorde, Metro Boomin, Miranda Lambert, NAV, Nicki Minaj, Noah Kahan, Pearl Jam, ... more
data.text:
Boominati Worldwide

Boominati Worldwide is a record label founded by GRAMMY Nominated Producer Metro Boomin and distributed by Republic Records & Universal Music Group. Since its inception, the label has seen three #1 Billboard 200 albums, four Billboard Top R&B/Hip-Hop Albums and Top Rap Albums, 42 Billboard Hot 100 hits and has released the official soundtrack for Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse, which vaulted into the Top 10 of the Billboard 200 and logged seven straight weeks on the Billboard Top Soundtrack Albums Chart.

Brushfire Records

Brushfire Records was born in 2002 at The Mango Tree studio in Hawaii when Jack Johnson and longtime friend Emmett Malloy wanted to create their own record label to put out the soundtracks for the renowned surf films they had been making under The Moonshine Conspiracy banner since 1998. Brushfire Records not only gave them the opportunity to release music from their surf films (Thicker Than Water and September Sessions) but also to release Jack’s music as well as connect and support other musicians, artists and friends, whose work they liked and respected including: Bahamas, Neil Halstead, ALO, Zach Gill, Paula Fuga, G. Love & Special Sauce, Money Mark, Matt Costa, Mason Jennings, Rogue Wave, Zee Avi, and Donovon Frankenreiter.

Casablanca Records

Casablanca Records, the legendary label of the 70’s, defined the sound of its era. During the infamous days of Studio 54, Casablanca launched the careers of artists such as Kiss, Parliament, Donna Summer and Giorgio Moroder. Founded by industry icon Neil Bogart and currently helmed by Brett Alperowitz, Casablanca celebrates a diverse global roster spanning across the Pop, Rock, and Dance genres. Casablanca Records is home to established luminaries and emerging stars including Alessandra, Chase & Status, Felix Jaehn, the Libertines, Martin Solveig, Sub Focus and TELYKAST.

Cash Money Records

Since 1991, Brothers Bryan "Birdman" Williams aka "Baby" and Ronald "Slim" Williams have built Cash Money Records into a legendary force in the music industry. Through tireless devotion and an unparalleled work ethic, the duo founded the legendary label in the New Orleans housing projects and elevated it into a multi-million-dollar empire and cultural tastemaker. Not only is the company revered as an iconic and enduring global street brand, but it’s also become the most successful independent record label in America boasting a bevy of chart-dominating, multi-platinum artists and Grammy Award winners and cumulative sales over 100 million albums worldwide, the roster includes Jacquees, Saxkboy KD, Onsight Deeda, Rublow, Juvenile and more. The label also houses Lil Wayne's imprint Young Money Entertainment (Drake and Nicki Minaj.) Cash Money Records is distributed by Republic Records, a division of Universal Music Group, the world's leading music company.

Federal Films

Federal Films is the newly created film and TV division within Republic Records that aims to bring compelling stories to audiences around the world. Most recently, Federal Films served as executive producers on the critically acclaimed Netflix film, They Cloned Tyrone starring Jamie Foxx and John Boyega, in Juel Taylor’s directorial debut. In partnership with South Korean K-Pop juggernaut JYP Entertainment, Federal Films created the recently released reality competition show A2K (America-to-Korea), an original series that follows the creation of the first North American girl super group trained through the K-Pop system. Federal Films has also ventured into the documentary space with HBO’s Love to Love You, Donna Summer, the definitive account of the iconic artist. Other documentaries include Ariana Grande: Excuse Me, I Love You (Netflix); Jonas Brothers’ Chasing Happiness (Amazon); and Todd Haynes’ highly acclaimed, The Velvet Underground (Apple TV+) that vividly evokes the band’s incandescent world, the creative origins of Lou Reed and John Cale and Andy Warhol’s fabled Factory. Additionally, Federal Films has served as executive producers on motion pictures including Marlowe (Liam Neeson, Jessica Lange), Meet Cute (Pete Davidson, Kaley Cuoco), The Hating Game (Lucy Hale), Anything’s Possible (Billy Porter), and A Million Little Pieces (Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Billy Bob Thornton).

Imperial Distribution

Imperial is an independent music company led by veteran label executive Glenn Mendlinger. The company signs, develops and markets emerging independent artists and creators, and partners with Ingrooves Music Group for distribution services. Since its inception in 2021, IMPERIAL a division of Republic Records, has released a series of highly successful projects across nearly all genres, generating more than 20 billion cumulative streams and 18 million adjusted albums for its artists’ releases. In the last year, IMPERIAL debuted eight Top 10 albums on the Billboard 200, with three of those landing in the Top 5 including two #1 albums from Stray Kids and a number #1 album for TOMORROW x TOGETHER. Among these releases, Bo Burnham’s INSIDE: The Songs has been certified platinum, as well as Stray Kids’ album 5-STAR and TOMORROW X TOGETHER’s album The Name Chapter: Temptation both receiving gold certification. IMPERIAL is home to a global roster of both established superstars and rising new talent, including Baby Gravy (Yung Gravy & bbno$), Bo Burnham, Brye, Chri$tian Gate$, Daddy Yankee, G Herbo, ITZY, Jelani Aryeh, Laurel, Miranda Lambert, Stray Kids, The Chemical Brothers, The Score, TOMORROW X TOGETHER, TWICE, and many more.

Lava Records

Lava Records is an artist-first label that offers the best of all worlds: the attention and commitment of an indie and the global reach and capabilities of the world's largest music company through its partnership with Republic/Universal. Originally founded in 1995 by Jason Flom, Lava has been the home to many multi-platinum superstars including Lorde and Jessie J as well as Grammy winners, and critical darlings. LAVA Records is now home to phenomenal artists including Greta Van Fleet, The Warning, YONAKA and more.

Republic Records: Kids & Family

Republic Records: Kids & Family launched as the official children’s division of Republic Records in 2022. The newly created division will cater to audiences ages 0-12 with fun and family-friendly music, collaborations, and experiences tailored to early development. Aimed to entertain the whole family, it offers engaging, educational, and explorative content, leveraging innovative partnerships with trusted brands such as Nickelodeon and many more. With an emphasis on high quality music and world-class

Universal Arabic Music

Universal Arabic Music (UAM) is dedicated to discovering, introducing and championing the artists, sounds and rich musical culture of the Middle East & North Africa (MENA) region to audiences around the world. Republic Records and its parent company Universal Music Group founded the new label in partnership with respected music mogul Wassim “SAL” Slaiby. As the first dedicated global label of its kind, UAM focuses on elevating Arabic music and artists to the forefront of popular music culture and help shining a global spotlight on the next wave of artists and talent from the region to break through, while creating new opportunities to introduce Arabic music and culture to new partners, platforms and brands worldwide.

Uptown Records

Uptown Records, founded in 1986 by the late Andre Harrell, is an original flagship Hip Hop and R&B label in the 80’s and 90’s that shaped the look and sound of an iconic era. Launching the careers of Sean “Diddy” Combs, Mary J. Blige, The Notorious B.I.G., Jodeci, Heavy D, Al B Sure!, Soul 4 Real and others, the label is now embarking on a new reimagined chapter. Helmed by Co-Presidents Saint Harraway and Marleny D. Reyes, Uptown is once again resonating and influencing the musical landscape of a new generation. The roster boasts a diverse array of global talents, including established superstars and emerging artistis such as Coi Leray, FLO (Island UK), Frex, Joe West, KB Mike and Pop Money. Uptown Records is a division of Republic Records & Universal Music Group, the world's leading music company.

XO Records

Co-founded by Academy® Award-nominated and RIAA diamond-certified trailblazer The Weeknd, XO stands out as a visionary creative collective and record label. Distributed via Republic Records as of 2012, it provides a home to not only The Weeknd, but also Belly, Nav and Black Atlass. Since its inception, the roster has had 21 #1 albums, 18 #1 songs and over 80 Billion global streams. XO has also been a part of amazing collaborations with Mercedes Benz, Marvel Comics, BAPE and more.
